snippet: A measure passed Thursday barring bonuses until customer service improves was just one of six anti-I.R.S. measures the House approved this week.
abstract: Supporters of IRS have begun making outspoken defense of agency in response to raft of anti-IRS bills passed by Republican-controlled House to mark annual tax-filing deadline; critics of legislation contend Republicans have continuously deprived agency of resources necessary to do its job and have unfairly blamed it for tax code that they have failed to rewrite, despite many promises to do so.
lead_paragraph: A measure passed Thursday barring bonuses until customer service improves was just one of six anti-I.R.S. measures the House approved this week.

headline.main: I.R.S. Fights Back Against House Republicans’ Attacks
headline.print_headline: I.R.S. Supporters Fight Back Against Republican Offensive
